template.template: Template Active OS Linux Disk Performance
template.name: Template Active OS Linux Disk Performance

item_prototype.name: Disk:$1:Discards:Merged
item_prototype.description: Field 13 -- # of discards merged See the description of field 2

item_prototype.name: Disk:$1:Discards:ms
item_prototype.description: Field 10 -- # of milliseconds spent doing I/Os This field increases so long as field 9 is nonzero.

item_prototype.name: Disk:$1:Discards:Ops per second
item_prototype.description: Field 12 -- # of discards completed This is the total number of discards completed successfully.

item_prototype.name: Disk:$1:IO:Currently Active
item_prototype.description: Field 9 -- # of I/Os currently in progress The only field that should go to zero. Incremented as requests are given to appropriate struct request_queue and decremented as they finish.

item_prototype.name: Disk:$1:Util
item_prototype.description: Field 10 -- # of milliseconds spent doing I/Os This field increases so long as field 9 is nonzero.

item_prototype.name: Disk:$1:Read:Merged
item_prototype.description: Field 2 -- # of reads merged, field 6 -- # of writes merged Reads and writes which are adjacent to each other may be merged for efficiency. Thus two 4K reads may become one 8K read before it is ultimately handed to the disk, and so it will be counted (and queued) as only one I/O. This field lets you know how often this was done.

item_prototype.name: Disk:$1:Read:ms
item_prototype.description: Field #7 Number of milliseconds spent reading This is the total number of milliseconds spent by all reads (as measured from __make_request() to end_that_request_last()).

item_prototype.name: Disk:$1:Read:Ops per second
item_prototype.description: Field 1 -- # of reads completed This is the total number of reads completed successfully.

item_prototype.name: Disk:$1:Read:Bytes/sec
item_prototype.description: Field 4 -- # of milliseconds spent reading This is the total number of milliseconds spent by all reads (as measured from __make_request() to end_that_request_last()).

item_prototype.name: Disk:$1:IO:Weight:ms
item_prototype.description: Field 11 -- weighted # of milliseconds spent doing I/Os This field is incremented at each I/O start, I/O completion, I/O merge, or read of these stats by the number of I/Os in progress (field 9) times the number of milliseconds spent doing I/O since the last update of this field. This can provide an easy measure of both I/O completion time and the backlog that may be accumulating.

item_prototype.name: Disk:$1:Write:Merged
item_prototype.description: Field 6 -- # of writes merged See the description of field 2.

item_prototype.name: Disk:$1:Write:ms
item_prototype.description: Field 8 -- # of milliseconds spent writing This is the total number of milliseconds spent by all writes (as measured from __make_request() to end_that_request_last()).

item_prototype.name: Disk:$1:Write:Ops per second
item_prototype.description: Field 5 -- # of writes completed This is the total number of writes completed successfully.

item_prototype.name: Disk:$1:Write:Bytes/sec
item_prototype.description: Field #10 This is the total number of sectors written successfully.

item.host: Template Active OS Linux Disk Performance
